meanings.definition: The act of moving in a zigzag pattern.
meanings.sent1: The shooling of the snake as it slithered across the sand was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: I watched the shooling of the kite as it danced in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The shooling of the puppy chasing its tail was both adorable and hilarious.
meanings.sent4: The shooling of the lightning across the sky was a spectacular sight.
meanings.sent5: The shooling of the river around the rocks created a beautiful natural artwork.

meanings.definition: A group of fish swimming together.
meanings.sent1: The colorful shooling of fish in the coral reef caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: We observed a large shooling of fish moving gracefully in the water.
meanings.sent3: The shooling of fish seemed to be having a lively underwater party.
meanings.sent4: The shooling of fish resembled a shimmering rainbow in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The synchronized shooling of fish was a stunning display of aquatic harmony.

meanings.definition: To move or swim in a group.
meanings.sent1: The birds shooling in the sky created intricate patterns with their flight.
meanings.sent2: We decided to shooling together to increase our chances of safety in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The children began to shooling towards the playground, excited to play together.
meanings.sent4: The dancers shooling across the stage captivated the audience with their synchronized movements.
meanings.sent5: The team members shooling towards the finish line cheered each other on for support.
